meanings.sent1: He whanged the door shut in anger.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith whanged the hammer on the hot metal.
meanings.sent3: The cat whanged the toy mouse across the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm whanged against the windows all night.
meanings.sent5: The baseball player whanged the ball out of the park with a powerful swing.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: The bell whanged loudly throughout the town.
meanings.sent2: The gong whanged in the temple, signaling the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The old piano whanged out a tune that made everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: The thunder whanged in the distance, announcing the coming storm.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks whanged in the sky, lighting up the night with colorful bursts.

meanings.sent1: She whanged through the crowd to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The car whanged down the road, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel whanged up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The river whanged over the rocks, rushing towards the waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The wind whanged through the trees, bending them with its force.
